docs.lead_paragraph: Food group Nestle is selling its sports nutrition business under the PowerBar and Musashi brands to U.S. group Post Holdings, the Swiss company said, in its drive to shed underperforming assets.

headline.main: Nestle Sells PowerBar and Musashi to U.S. Group Post Holdings
headline.print_headline: Nestle Sells PowerBar and Musashi to U.S. Group Post Holdings

docs.snippet: Food group Nestle is selling its sports nutrition business under the PowerBar and Musashi brands to U.S. group Post Holdings, the Swiss company said, in its drive to shed underperforming assets.

docs.lead_paragraph: Post Holdings Inc. is buying the PowerBar and Musashi brands from Nestle SA, further diversifying its business by expanding into the active nutrition category.

headline.main: Post Buying PowerBar, Musashi Brands From Nestle
headline.print_headline: Post Buying PowerBar, Musashi Brands From Nestle

docs.snippet: Post Holdings Inc. is buying the PowerBar and Musashi brands from Nestle SA, further diversifying its business by expanding into the active nutrition category.

docs.lead_paragraph: Herbalife Ltd estimated fourth-quarter profit and sales above market forecasts, dealing a setback to investor William Ackman who has accused the nutrition and weight loss company of being a pyramid scheme and taken a big short position on the stock.

headline.main: Herbalife Estimates Profit Above Forecasts, Reassures Investors
headline.print_headline: Herbalife Estimates Profit Above Forecasts, Reassures Investors

docs.snippet: Herbalife Ltd estimated fourth-quarter profit and sales above market forecasts, dealing a setback to investor William Ackman who has accused the nutrition and weight loss company of being a pyramid scheme and taken a big short position on the stock.

docs.lead_paragraph: A colorful stir-fry with a variety of textures.

headline.main: Stir-Fried Brown Rice With Red Chard and Carrots

docs.snippet: A colorful stir-fry with a variety of textures.

docs.lead_paragraph: The jottings we make in the books we own may well be among the highest tributes we pay to authors.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Andrew D Scrimgeour, dean of libraries at Drew University, underscores the importance of some marginalia, which can reveal much about important scholars' engagement with text and the development of their ideas; contends that the jottings readers make in books are signs of respect and signs of engagement, and can be among the highest tribute paid to authors.
docs.snippet: The jottings we make in the books we own may well be among the highest tributes we pay to authors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Team executives wanted to offer some of their younger players a regimented off-season training program, and Ruben Tejada wound up having the most to prove.

headline.main: Before Hitting and Fielding, Young Mets Seek Edge by Running and Stretching
headline.print_headline: Before Hitting and Fielding, Young Mets Seek Edge by Running and Stretching

docs.abstract: New York Mets executives wanted to offer some of their younger players a regimented off-season training program, and shortstop Ruben Tejada wound up having the most to prove.
docs.snippet: Team executives wanted to offer some of their younger players a regimented off-season training program, and Ruben Tejada wound up having the most to prove.

docs.abstract: Reactions to the State of the Union address and preparations for the Super Bowl will dominate the conversation on the Sunday morning shows.
docs.snippet: Reactions to the State of the Union address and preparations for the Super Bowl will dominate the conversation on the Sunday morning shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: The author of a book about nutrition says good habits must be learned early on.
docs.snippet: The author of a book about nutrition says good habits must be learned early on.

docs.lead_paragraph: The giant retailer said winter storms and cuts in food stamps would affect its bottom line when it reports earnings in February.

headline.main: Walmart Trims Its Profit Forecast for the 4th Quarter
headline.print_headline: Walmart Trims Its Profit Forecast for the 4th Quarter

docs.abstract: Walmart lowers its profit expectations for its fourth quarter, citing cuts to food stamps and an especially tough winter; giant retailer says profit will most likely come in at low end of its guidance range of $1.60 to $1.70 a share, or even slightly below, and weakness in quarter is also likely to be drag on year.
docs.snippet: The giant retailer said winter storms and cuts in food stamps would affect its bottom line when it reports earnings in February.
